intro: Isonandra diplostemon, commonly known as the white-flowered starwood, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a glossy surface. The fruit is a follicle that splits open to release its seeds.
